name: Free Running
SlySquids Junk Yard Dog v1.0
description: A janky theme deck!

name: QUe3N's Tax 1.2
description:
Updated minor change from Liberated accounts to armitage codebusting (thx @pinkwarrior)

Just a typical Reina Roja: Freedom Fighter deck that tries to exploit D4v1d, Knight and Overmind as much as possible using e3 Feedback Implants.

name: Meat Sandwich 1.0.2
description: The evolution continues. Drop the Project Junebug for Closed Accounts. It gives me another reason to use Sea Source besides flat-lining. Polite comments and suggestions are welcomed.

name: Sneaky little bugger.
CcharmMQuetzal1.1
description:
I feel as though Quetzal desires a deck void of datasucker/deja vu/parasite suite. Her early pressure can be utilized to great effect with a number of powerful cards in hand early: -legwork -Keyhole -Lamprey

All of the breakers in this deck are meant to synergize with Quetzal's obvious include of e3 Implants, the provide fast easy access at low cost. Deep red helps knights/Rooks install as well as bumps MU up to 7 for overmind. Armitage feels good in the deck at 1c after an expensive 1st or second turn. I chose to spend extra influence on Legwork as I think it is the most powerful card vs NEH and HB. It also works well with Imp. Enjoy!

name: AI Keyhole
description:
Built in theory, definitely needs real world testing. It's a basic AI Keyhole deck, nothing too fancy.

Quetzal's ability makes her want 1 good run per turn. Keyhole seems to be the perfect card to exploit that. Keyhole wants Hades Shard.

You naturally want e3 Feedback Implants, and that in turn brings in Knight and Overmind. Both of these programs want Deep Red. They both go well with Clone Chip. With Clone Chip, you want triple Parasite. Scrubbed helps your Overmind and Parasite since you are not running Datasucker nor Wyrm. Pawn ensures longevity of your Knight too, since they are going to be your primary breaker.

I went with Cyberfeeder as I think the recurring creds will really help in the long run. D4v1d seems like a good emergency card that can fit, especially with e3 Feedback Implants on the board.

Finding a Scrubber is always useful. I'm on the fence about Déjà Vu in this deck, as you are not really running that many virus.

RIP NRDB

here's one more goofy deck before the site shuts down. please use some of this ice to protect your servers from lawsuits.

name: BrainyJinteki
Supplying the Activists
Shadows of the Sun v2.1
description: RIP NetrunnerDB. You've been good to us.

name: TheRoyalTenninBombs
description:
The original version of this deck started out much larger (59 cards). It didn't quite flow right and this version seems to be better. The idea is a recursion of Junebug and Snare as much as possible. I had to cut a copy of archived and rework when dwindling the deck down, but like I said it seems to flow better.

I am working on another version of this deck with less recursion and Woodcutter, but getting the influence to work is difficult.

name: Whizzard
Ninja with a Paintbrush
Stealing ain't that hard (Kargan Mod)
Reina 0.6
Cortez Is Coming
description:
Netrunnerdb rules, FFG drools.

"You didn't hear it from me, but they're shutting NetrunnerDB down so that no one can get their hands on this decklist." ~FFG Insider

"If this was the last deck built on this site, I could die happy" - Alsciende

"It just...wins. It's unbelievable." - Mediohxcore

"Better than Account Siphon and Caprice Nisei combined!" - AlexFrog

"One time, at a party, I went through a whole pack of condoms with this asian chick who thought I was Liam Neeson." - Nordrunner
